prolog:
:- dynamic house/5.

% member(Element, List)
member(X, [X|_]).
member(X, [_|T]) :- member(X, T).

% house(Nationality, Color, Pet, Drink, Cigarette)
% Example house data: house(Nationality, Color, Pet, Drink, Cigarette)

solve(Houses) :-
    length(Houses, 5), % There are five houses
    member(house(englishman, red, _, _, _), Houses),
    member(house(spaniard, _, dog, _, _), Houses),
    member(house(_, green, _, coffee, _), Houses),
    member(house(_, _, _, milk, _), Houses),
    member(house(_, yellow, _, _, marlboro), Houses),
    member(house(norwegian, _, _, _, _), Houses),
    next_to(house(_, green, _, coffee, _), house(_, ivory, _, _, _), Houses),
    right_of(house(_, green, _, coffee, _), house(_, ivory, _, _, _), Houses),
    member(house(_, _, zebra, water, _), Houses),
    member(house(_, _, fish, _, _), Houses).

% Right of X is to the immediate right of Y in the list
right_of(A, B, [B, A | _]).
right_of(A, B, [_ | T]) :- right_of(A, B, T).

% Next to X is either immediately left or right of Y
next_to(A, B, [B, A | _]).
next_to(A, B, [A, B | _]).
next_to(A, B, [_ | T]) :- next_to(A, B, T).
